content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
EDIT AS OF 20TH APRIL 2016Well, it's finally out. Hooray!And to sweeten the deal, owners of this game from Early Access automatically get No Time To Explain Remastered, if they don't already have it. :D=================================================================EDIT AS OF 6TH APRIL 2016I finally took a look back at this game due to it releasing out of Early Access 2 weeks from this edit, and I gotta say wow, they've really improved a lot since the last time I checked in (date in my edit below). There's new music (the old one was nice but repetitive after a while) and new sound effects, they've put the local party mode into the game, and there's going to be a story mode too!But the thing that I was clamouring for the most in my initial review? It's FINALLY HERE!If the game had any option for setting search parameters to half the world by default (or maybe even the whole world, since I never even saw that), that would be great.And indeed, to my joy, they did. They've now added the option to specify which region to search for matches. THANK YOU!Also, the character trail shop is now live. I think this works particularly well - none of the trails, as far as I know, improve your character, and are mainly for cosmetic effect, so this isn't pay to win. Another nifty idea to generate more revenue after this game's been bundled quite a lot of times already. (But, as reported[tinybuild.com], it has helped to boost the online community so well.)I'll leave my old review as it was, just note that it is partially (with respect to the matchmaking) outdated. I have however increased my EA rating, and this only makes this game much easier for me to recommend now.=================================================================EDIT AS OF 19TH AUGUST 2015 After changing Steam's download region, a method which enabled me to find online multiplayer matches in another game, I was able to join a match nearly-instantaneously. A VERY odd workaround - I shouldn't have to do this to even begin with, but at least I was finally able to find matches. ================================================================A fresh and vibrant concept that marries platforming and racing in an almost seamless manner.It took me a while to really try SpeedRunners, and that was on a whim after watching several Youtubers and Twitch streamers play the game. It seemed like really great fun to play with some friends, and it proved to be as such.Another gem published by tinyBuild games (wow, they're really starting to make a name for themselves in the world of publishing) and developed by DoubleDutch games (I checked, they are based in the Netherlands, hence their name...LOL), SpeedRunners tells the story of up to 4 superheroes all racing and sabotaging each other in order to get to crimes the fastest. (And yet, the funny thing is that every map is basically all the runners going in a loop without actually getting to a crime scene...)The game does seem like it needs more polish, despite the great concept here at play. Once in a while I get the occasional game crash, sometimes I find (oddly) that the game doesn't respond to my controls, there are a few weird bugs here and there where I am eliminated from a round a lot earlier than expected......but all these pale in comparison to the fact that online matchmaking for me is incredibly annoying and almost always fruitless. Being on the other side of the world as compared to most people doesn't really help, since the matchmaking starts from your continent, and only switches to half the world after an increase in 2 leagues. Seriously, how many leagues does this thing have? I actually searched up to 23 leagues in half the world once before I threw in the towel. I don't even know why I searched that high either - I'm a novice! If the game had any option for setting search parameters to half the world by default (or maybe even the whole world, since I never even saw that), that would be great. Refer to my edits at the top of this review.Otherwise, the core elements of this game are incredibly great. There are a wide variety of powerups to frustrate your opponents with and slow them down or pull them back. Not that many official maps but there is a theoretically infinite supply with in-built Steam Workshop support. If you can grab a few friends to play a few rounds of multiplayer, you're probably going to have a fun time. (Or you might end up becoming ex-friends with those friends. It can swing either way.)If you don't have any friends to play with, and/or cannot be bothered to play online with other people, you can actually practice your skills using bots. There's also a single player "Origins" mode where you have to reach a goal within a certain amount of time. This has been replaced with a new story mode where you race bots. Very decent alternatives that are adequately able to account for any lack of real life hoomanz.Now if only they will do something about the matchmaking, I could probably play this for a lot more time yet.When to buy The game has been bundled a few times; the cheapest it has gone is 75% off. Quite worth picking it up from these sources/at these prices, it's great. :)9.0/10This game was previously demoed on the Who's Gaming Now?! Twitch Channel[www.twitch.tv]. We regularly demo indie games on the channel, consider tossing us a follow.

Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners, I never thought I would enjoy this game until I actually played it. It's a high adrenaline game that always forces you to be thinking about what to do next.But this game has quite a few pros and cons.PROS:- Fun- Challenging but not too annoying- Unique Characters that aren't just a cosmetic upgrade, but are treated like a whole new person- Many ways to play, including a story mode.- The way the game is made, you can play it for a long time and it won't get old- The game is really rewarding when things start going your way.CONS:- Story mode can get a bit boring- After you have become a complete expert at the game and you don't have anyone to play with, you may want to use multiplayer, which can be laggy.- The running can get a bit repetitive after a long time.OVERALL:The game is really fun at the moment and is great, only dropped down by multiplayer and repetitivity. 8/10

								Early Release: SpeedRunners  "Cut-throat multiplayer running game that pits 4 players against each other, locally and/or online. Run, jump, swing around, and use devious weapons and pick-ups to knock opponents off-screen! One of the most competitive games you'll ever play."  good description.  Has Bots too, who are very good players.  Side scroller with Comicbook looking graphics.  Hard to master.  Many maps.  Runs but was set odd on my screen.  The campaign game was a bit glichy, keyboard kept losing movement keys, has to restart map often. Has Steam achievements and trading cards, controller support.Played on Free Play weekend.  Check it out when it is full release.for more info:

content:
Posted: December 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is a 4 player platforming game based in a city where there isn't much crime so the superheroes SpeedRunner, Unic, Cosmonaut Comrade, Hothead and Moonraker (more superheroes may be added after this review) must race towards the crime.I absolutely love this game, the controls are simple, the levels are beautiful, amazing community, the character design is simple yet great, the powerups are awesome and you don't need friends to enjoy this game even though it's a multiplayer game!I have spent hours on end just playing this game and finding people who love this game as much as I do and start trying to find who is the ultimate SpeedRunner or just try and run the map backwards.This game is ultimately worth my money and most likely yours. 10/10

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 18, 2016
 An Excellent Fast Paced Platformer!The concept of this game is very simple to grasp, outrun your opponents off the screen and don't get eliminated by falling behind. However for such a simple concept this game has a fair bit of depth with many levels to play through. What's more is that there are many levels that have been created by the community that you can play through the steam workshop, and you can create your own level if you wish and submit it too. This is a great game for playing with friends, as it caters for a fun and casual experience if you wish, or as my group discovered hours into playing the game, a very quiet experience where everyones concentration levels are through the rooof trying to time each and every jump,slide, grapple, and powerup perfectly. There are also modifiers to the rules available so that you can choose what weapons are available in your game.This game is a must buy as there are certainly many laughs to be had, and friendships to be destoyed (just like in mario kart) :D

number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
Early Access Review
								While Speedrunner started life as a successful flash-based browser game, having currently been played well over 8 million times, it gathered more attention when it was released on Xbox live Indie Games in the summer of 2011. Since then, it has been critically acclaimed for its tight controls and exhilarating local multiplayer mode, receiving high review scores and the Indie Game Magazine award for Best Xbox Live Indie Game of the Year 2011.Well, now it’s time for Speedrunner to take on PC’s biggest platform and prove itself as one of the best multiplayer platformers out there. Listening to feedback from players and critics, DoubleDutch Games have taken their time to improve the game by offering over twice as much content, an advanced leaderboards and matchmaking system and  a much-requested online multiplayer, allowing players to show off their grappling hook skills against friends and foes around the world.In short, SpeedRunners is a 4 player competitive platformer with grappling hooks, power-ups, and interactive environments. Run, jump, swing around, fire rockets, grapple onto people to knock them off screen to prove you are faster than them!

Early Access Review
								Incredibly addicting fast paced racing game with a *huge* learning curve of tricks, jumps, and routes, with a colorful cast of characters. One of the few games capable of replacing my adrenalin addiction with natural adrenalin.Best played with a group of friends who are at the same skill level, but has a small but friendly online community and matchmaking system for when your friends rage-quit (expect to run into the same 8-10 people over several weeks).Easily the most fun I've ever had in the multiplayer game, and no matter how good you get, there's always someone better.Better yet, it runs great on Linux with Wine.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Fun multiplayer Speedrunning game for up to 4 players.  Gotta go fast like Sanic, right? Yep indeed you do!  It's a highly competitive game.If you play with people that are much higher rank than you, just do it.  Don't rage.  You will learn the tricks quite a LOT faster than you would playing with people the same rank as you!  With enough practise, you'll be ace.You may find that people say it's impossible to play with over 80 ping, but it IS possible!  You just need to time some things earlier & predict where they're going to be.Recent update made it harder to find lobbies (playing with 200 ping isn't that bad, come on).  It's when a ping is unstable which ruins the play.This screenshot was taken when the US/UK/Europe people would still be awake.


Broadening search to 169 leagues above or below your rank.

Let me tell you something, There's a chance my username sound familiar. That's because I lurk /b/ and I'm in over half the beg threads. I DO NOT BUY MY OWN GAMES. I don't do it. If I can get something for free, you bet your jail-bait♥♥♥♥♥I'm going to get it for free. So you know this game is ♥♥♥♥ing excellent when I reach into my own torn up wallet, pull out my debit card, and buy a game for myself after only playing it a few hours.If you're on the fence about buying this, get it. 10/10 would get cheek blasted by veteran players again.

content:
Posted: January 14
What I liked:  Great skill based racing game Online is alive even for a small game The flow of running, powerups and swinging to win a match How they designed the game to help those that fall behindWhat You Need to Know:  This game can be played solo, there is a 1 hour story mode that really is just showing you levels and unlocks. Having credits made it weird. 1 HOUR!! This game can be played casual if playing with your friends, bots or a mix, as learning the maps is required if you want to even think about doing well.  The bots can be changed to match your level whether a noob or hardcore player. They have easy, medium (that’s me), hard and unfair. They do have a ranking system so you can play with people of similar skill. I haven’t done this yet, as you need to level up your profile about 3 hours to be able to unlock it. You gain xp in when playing online, or solo. Must be standard maps, not custom ones You can play unranked as well, but mostly you’ll end up with people that have played for 100’s of hours. Luckily the community isn’t toxic and will try to help or just show off how god like they are compared to you There are powerups that all have counters, by either you dodging them, or using other powerups to cancel them out. Like dropping a box behind you to blow up a rocket. Or sliding underneath a hook grab. This is great as it gives depth and strategy to a game that seems casual. So it’s not Mario Kart where powerups are unavoidable. My biggest reason I hate racing game, mostly car games is that when in the lead, it’s easy to win. So how do you catch up? In Speedrunners, the leader gets closer to the front he gets less to see what’s in front of him, which can cause them to make mistakes letting those in the back a chance to gain. This is a wonder way to make it interesting and give you a chance to ketchup. (I can see once you play enough this won’t be an issue, but high level play won’t be for everyone, so this is good) If you want to get this game to goof off with your friends I can see it being great for that. You’ll all suck and laugh at how much failure will happen. I don’t have friends so, I don’t know that feeling "( If you want to get serious and play competitive, this game has depth to allow that. Playing online for me, everyone is so much better, I have to stick to bots, also map knowledge is so important that it kind of hurts the game if time played gap is big enough probably won’t play this and get into like I would want to, to get good, it’s just time is scarce and spending over 50+ hours to learn every map and be proficient isn’t possible for me. I got other great multiplayer games I focus on. I still recommend everyone try it out, it’s a blast for casual pick up and play too. My Score: APaid: Included in $5 Bundle  Skill curve:  Medium    Wait times: under 1 minute Games similar I recommend:  Overcooked Mount Your Friends Magicka Ultimate Chicken Horse Rocket League

												This game is really great. The amount of optimization you can have on a map is insane. Just when you think you've hit the best possible strategy and timing, someone else comes along and rips that dream from you and you're forced to take it back. In 18 hours I never reached the most optimized run. I was great but there was always someone who was better and that is a very good thing.I haven't played the game for a year but in the time I spent with it there were no negatives.

Early Access Review
								Just a quick recommendation before this short review begins: play this with friends. Trust me. It's very fun.SpeedRunners is a very fast-paced fun little game which keeps you on your toes. There are 10 characters you can pick from so far, including a pink unicorn, a Soviet spaceman and a scout from a certain game (I'm looking at you, TF2).As it is still in early access, more characters and stages are likely to appear. And, if you can't wait long for new stages, build your own in the level editor. For $10, I'd say buying this would be worth the risk.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								At the time of writing, this game is still in early access so bear that in mind when considering the purchase if relevant!Speed Runners is an incredibly fun and competitive platforming racing game. Each match can have up to four players and throughout levels you can pick up power-ups to either gain an advantage or to screw others over by using the golden hook or by dropping a load of crates down in front of them. I love the art style personally and the levels are pretty well designed and the user created levels are equally as good! One problem that I do sometimes experience however is network problems, namely lag when I'm spectating a match after being eliminated but also whilst participating. But, it is to be expected as this is an Early Access title. To be honest you can't really go wrong especially for the price.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners will put your fingers/thumbs to the edge in this fast pace coop/versus racing game. The controls are tight with both a keyboard and gamepad, the racetracks have a great design. The workshop makes this game have never ending amounts of content, now all you need are some people to play with and this game is golden. Whether you play this game in single player against bots, play with randoms online or play with friends you will have a good time. SpeedRunners is a must have if you want to play some games while friends are over, the couch coop in this a vastly supperior than some $60 AAA games I have played in recent memory. However nothing is perfect, the soundtrack to this game while catchy at first does become quite annoying, since it's pretty much the same song in a constant loop. It's nice that the developers let you disable the music. Graphics settings are a little disappointing, however this really isn't that big of an issue for a title like this since the game is pretty easy to run. Overall i'd say it's a good 8.0/10 if your only able to play by yourself or with randoms onlineWhen you play this game with friends you can easily bump the score up to a 9.4/10, it's that good

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

Although it can be very difficult when your friends are better than you, it brings out this fun side of competition where anything can happen.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												People told me before I bought it that this game is a Mario Kart in 2D. They were totally right. I used to play a lot of Mario Kart Wii when I was younger and got better and better at it with each race I did. SpeedRunners works a lot in the same way. You'll pass through the same levels over and over again, but you'll always find a new technique to go faster or trick your opponents. With time, you'll get better and better, and after a few hundred hours, you'll be as skilled as the hundreds of other good players out there. All it takes is some practice.I love this game. It's so fun and interesting, especially the multiplayer. :3

												People told me before I bought it that this game is a Mario Kart in 2D. They were totally right. I used to play a lot of Mario Kart Wii when I was younger and got better and better at it with each race I did. SpeedRunners works a lot in the same way. You'll pass through the same levels over and over again, but you'll always find a new technique to go faster or trick your opponents. With time, you'll get better and better, and after a few hundred hours, you'll be as skilled as the hundreds of other good players out there. All it takes is some practice.I love this game. It's so fun and interesting, especially the multiplayer. :3

content:
Posted: February 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Before I begin, I want to say that I have watched this game develop hugely from the beginning of 2014.Now, SpeedRunners is a fast paced racing/platformer game which relys heavily on map memory. The game itself is simple, but trying to master it is another question. I've played just over 260 hours, which is a fair amount of time I assume, and have found that the game has developed amazinly since 2014 and quite frankly I am shocked how many people now play it. Whether it be through youtubers or humble bundle the SpeedRunners developers are very friendly. From hosting tournaments where the winner gets special perks in-game to creating a level designer to the game which adds so much more depth to the game. This game will always be one of those games where I go "Gosh, don't you remember SpeedRunners. What a great game."I love this game and will keep playing for a long time.

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								Ahh. Speedrunners: the death of us all or as I like to call it, The Friendship Destroyer. Introduction and anecdotes!Yes, that's right this game is overwhelmingly competitive and would spark rage into your opponents as you all battle it out on 13 official maps and a variety of workshop maps that are being made everyday by the community via their very own level editor! What do you mean, "the friendship destroyer"?Well then my friend, let's just say that continuously blowing them up with rockets and bombs (two of the many item pick ups in the game) didn't really appeal to them as much... Turns out they must've un-installed the game or something... Shame really I would've loved to hear the sweet sound of keyboard smashing :( But in all seriousness, this game is fun, exciting and unpredictable. Full of intense 1 on 1 situations as the death border comes closing in on you and your rivals masking the map behind it relying on your knowledge of the map to guide your superhero player in the right direction...Speedrunners is a very easy game to get into..... or should I say, get addicted to; wanting to win just one more game or to just get that final few points to rank up to the next league it's definitely hours worth spending...When you first open speedrunnersThe game puts you straight into a tutorial as soon as you load it in teaching you the basics of speedrunners and the controls you're using to jump, slide and swing and all the other jazz such as using your pick-ups... This means that new players will pick up the game quickly and will be soon off to get to their dream league...How long I've been playing and what to expect from ranked:I've been playing for at least 74 hours now (in total aha, as addicting as this game is I don't think I'd do 74 hours in one session :P) and I've managed to get up to expert league and I'm in the top 10 in getting to the bronze league... Which is harder than you'd think... The higher league you go the more advanced players will be and the more skilled they will be too. More experienced players would know the best routes and would be quick on their feet to secure their wins using all tactics built up from previous experiences and knowledge built up over time.This amps up the competitiveness of the game and draws you in. Tips, tricks and routes:As you do this, you tend to pick up on some of the tricks other advanced players use and you'll notice tips such as saving your boost and being sure to hit those angle blocks to gain more momentum and speed.. It will be vital that you learn new routes too for the individual maps as going certain routes will be faster than others and some may be more advantageous than others too such as getting into the VIP Area on Nightclub, A tricky route to learn at first (how to get there) but getting there or not can be a great game changer and would definitely score you some easy rounds IF your opponents don't manage to get there.AdditionalThe artwork/visuals and mechanics of the game are very good and look very pretty (you won't get bored of it too easily is what I mean) and it's being updated constantly; this includes layouts, new characters being added and even secret characters which you'd have to do some digging around to find out how to get them ;) and many more. The animations for all the characters are great and are unique to suit their design and style and they are all fun to play with. Some characters have different skins such as the main Speedrunner can be blue, white, yellow or black for example so you can personalise your favourite characters to suit you..ConclusionI would totally recommend this game for anybody who is competitive and/or wants to have heaps of fun in one single session. There are a few bugs scattered around the place which is reasonable for an early access game but with an amazing community and an active team they're being fixed regularly thanks to the wonderful community reporting them and requesting ideas or changes to the game that are always considered by the developers to make the game ready for launch.And for a game only worth £6.99 It's definitely worth it!OutroThank you for taking the time to read through my horribly structured reviewIf you would like to play sometime then don't be shy to add my steam and let me know you came from this review! :)-Syrunner (/Cloaker is MINE!)

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Crime-fighting.  Its a difficult job.  In the world of "Speedrunners" its difficult for reasons you might not have considered.  What would happen in a world where Superheroes were as prolific as those with an AA in business?  Where only the hungry and competitive get to be employed for their unique anti-villain skillsets, while the rest are relegated to fry cook duty at the local deep fry eatery.  Speedrunners casts you as a fledgling costumed vigilante desperate to break onto the scene as 'This City's #1 Hero!"  The catch?  You are not the only one.  Thus, we come to the core of the game, which is not actually fighting crime at all; rather, its a mad dash to beat your fellow would-be champions of justice to the scene of the crime, by any means necessary.  What does this translate to?  A Mario-Kart-esque footrace across rooftops, through buildings, and any other place you could seemingly run at semi-full bore.  Players (up to 4 of them) pick their hero of choice from a multitude of excellent original characters (and YouTube personalities!), and then beat feet (and each other), picking up power ups, swinging on grappling hooks, and tripping each other as they attempt to leave their opponents in the dust.  The action is quite simple.  Heroes run in a repeating/looping level, attempting to have their opponents leave the shared screen by being outpaced.  This is accomplished with the help of numerous tools.  Players may find themselves in possession of seeker rockets to sling at opponents, remote mines, drop-able crates, and Scorpion-esque ranged grappling devices, just to name a few of the tools available.  Players are able to double jump and wall jump, as well as deploy grappling hooks to avoid obstacles (with mechanics similar to the ninja rope from Worms Armageddon). You can even build speed by manipulating gravity and centrifugal force with well-place grapples.  Once the first opponent is knocked out (by meeting an untimely end at the edge of the screen as the rest of the dynamic do-gooders race on), things really begin to heat up.  The music changes, and the edges of the screen shrink, giving the remaining players less and less room to maneuver.  This can continue to a point where skilled players continue their parkour punchfest in a screen roughly 1/3 the size of normal.  Last man standing wins the round; first to 3 wins takes the match.  Sounds delightfully simple doesn't it?  And you'd be right to think so, given the initial smattering of levels from developer tinyBuild.  The game features Steam Workshop support, and the level of complexity in some of the user generated levels can really ramp up the difficulty when it comes to twitch reactions and puzzling out the fastest, most appropriate route.  The game sports competitive multiplayer, as well as local and online play.  You may play with a keyboard or controller (the latter being this authors preference).  Having said all that, I offer you this review and endorsement with full disclosure.  Having played this game at length with people of varying skill levels, bear the following disclaimers in mind:- There is a bit of a learning curve here, particularly in the competitive scene.  Its ok to fail, as long as its still fun, right?- This game is in Early Access.  Its not perfect, but it is pretty darn good.- Furniture and peripherals may be at risk during gameplay.  Specifically, gamepads and keyboards may experience stress fractures during tense matches, or become heavily moistened by an abundance of palm perspiration.  Furniture, on the other hand, may become damaged due to severe body contractions, particularly during close matches.  To elaborate, whilst racing you may experience "butt fist," a tensing ones backside that may result in loss of underwear and damage to ones gaming chair.If I haven't scared you off with the potential dangers above, Speedrunners is a no-brainer buy.  So, what are you waiting for?  Break out your spandex, knee-high lace boots, and cape, and prepare to race..... FOR JUSTICE!!!!!!Stop by and see our other reviews at:http://www.dustimusprime.com/

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												This game has really nice fast paced gameplay and something MANY games lack and that would be local multiplayer. This game is beyond fantastic when playing with friends to pass some time. I often play it on the train with a friend of mine to pass the two hours.And even though this review so far seems positive, that only applies to the local MP and VERY few online matches.This game is overflowing with cancerous smurfers who abuse every single glitch, bug to just steam roll you. When you come into this game you're a legitimate entry or beginner league. So are those idiots who need to compensate something and take it out on new players. All of them either make new accounts solely to buy the game or de-rank in ranked by just letting everyone beat you.The end result is you (newbie) getting paired up with up to 3 pixel perfect virgins who do absolutely nothing but play the game from the looks of it. You'll know it when you see it for yourself.But as I said at the start:This game IS fun if you have friends (People you actually know IRL) to play with. I would have made this review positive but it's more likely that anyone who gets the game will go play a random game online than a game with their friends and that is why I can't recommend this game.If you're looking for local MP, feel free to get it. (I honestly waited for a sale because I kind of knew what I was going into with the Online and I suggest you do too but it's your money.)

content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
Early Access Review
								This game is in beta right now, but I have really high hopes for this. A racing platformer game. So simple, yet so damned fun. You race three other people through a course, with powerups, and boosts, switches, shortcuts, and more. The game is pretty basic right now, but oh god is it fun. I've played a few rounds with my friend, and we had a great time. The singleplayer part is okay, just kinda helps you refine your skills. Playing MP with other people is a blast. The bots are kind of broken, however. When my friend and I played, we saw the bots going in the wrong direction once. It's still buggy, which is to be expected from a beta, but this game is fantastic. Looking forward to the full thing.

content:

												This is one of the best and most addictive indie games, ever. It's a very unique game as it combines three quite different genres -  racing, platforming and grappling (if that counts). It is playable in single-player with its campaign and the option to play against the CPU but it's definitely more enjoyable playing with friends. With its DLC, you can even play as famous YouTubers such as PewDiePie and Markiplier. There are also a wide variety of maps and modifiers to choose from to spice things up. In addition, the Steam Workshop allows players to race on heaps of community-created stages or even create your own. Overall, it's a great, competitive game that you can play with friends.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								I'm really loving the game so far, and at this price could already recommend it to anyone.Edit (19-9-15): As of the last update, most of my concerns aren't valid anymore. Though I haven't had the chance to play a lot, I noticed a variety of music tracks got added, and the game hasn't crashed since. The only issue I still have with the game is the fact that it can at times be hard to find a match, especially during off-hours. Hopefully this will improve in the future. Other than that, it's still a great game.Positive:-a lot of fun, and fairly original gameplay-a lot of variety in characters, though this doesn't really affect gameplay (which I suppose is yet another good thing)-the game seems quite polished in the sense that most things seem to work as intended, and there are a lot of things that make you go 'oh yeah, good idea' while playing (though, of course, I can't think of any now)-multiplayer works rather well, though it can take a minute to find a game, which I'm guessing will improve as the player base grows-ranked matches-pretty cool community so far. Seen some rage quits, but no proper moaning/swearing as of now-community made content (just maps as far as I can tell, but who knows)Negave:-the game occasionally crashes for me (haven't yet looked up whether more people have this, but I'm guessing they do). This doesn't happen frequently enough to be a major issue, as restarting and loading the game doesn't take much, but it still sucks when you happen to be in a ranked match or with a nice bunch of people-the music gets rather repetitive, which isn't that big a deal. It would be nice if the music selection had some more variety at some pointAll considered, I'd really recommend it to anyone who enjoys the idea of a side-scrolling racer (runner...) which had me actually laughing out loud at times.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Okay... gue edit lagi dengan menggunakan bahasa Indonesia.SKOR: 9 dari 10.Wait, serius lo Wing?Kesan pertama: ini adalah game platformer tentang balap lari. So, lo dengan 3 orang lo berlomba lari menuju.... nope, tidak ada garis finish. Menariknya adalah ada buanya tantangan disetiap map, mulai dari duri, jurang, angin, dan sebagainya. Belum lagi kalau player lain memberikan roket, menarik lo, atau mengebom lo. Iya, ini semacam lomba lari tetapi juga survival. Grafik: Kartun sederhana. Bukan berarti sederhana lalu jelek. Justru game seperti ini sebaiknya memang pantas dengan grafik kartun yang sederhana. Tujuannya adalah agar bisa dimainkan disemua tipe PC. Walau pun begitu, Dev nya termasuk Dev yang rajin dan terus mengembangkan animasi dan berbagai macam bug yang ada di game.Gameplay: ADDICTED! Serius game ini itu bener bener dibuat untuk main bareng dengan temen lo. Bayangin lo dan 3 orang temen lo saling tarik menarik, saling membuang roket, atau saling meledakan bom sambil berlari menuju lingkarang yang gak ada batasnya. Eh siapa bilang gampang? Justru dalam waktu kurang dari 1 menit lo tau tau berada dipaling belakang, keluar dari 'layar' dan akhirnya kalah. Game ini mungkin waktu pertama kali agak susah untuk dimainkan, tapi semakin lama lo memainkan, lo semakin teradaptasi dengan map nya, senjatanya, turbo, dan berbagai macam rintangan lain.Storyline: Biasa aja. Story line disini menurut gue bagaikan practice ground. Jadi sebelum lo head-to-head dengan teman lo, ada baiknya lo memainkan story line sendiri agar 'lenjeh' dengan gerakan gerakan yang ada didalam game. Gue berani kasih skor 9 dari 10.Kenapa? karena developernya rajin update, gameplaynya addictive, grafiknya sederhana tapi menarik, dan terdapat steamwork sehingga lo gak bosan untuk memainkannya lagi dan lagi.

number of helpful: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
												A good concept with decent game play. I don't think it's worth it's stated price but it's still in early access. Time will only tell! My hope is that they add some mini-game functions or attempt to play with the rules of the game. (This game is local co-op)!Speed Runners is a game about running the fastest, being first while leaving your enemies in the dust. By being last, you risk the chance of being eliminated by being off the edge of the screen. The gameplay itself for the moment is decently good but has a lot -First player controls the pace and controls the camera. Take the long route or risk grabbing a pick-up may cost you a life. The scoring system as of current requires three wins. This means you need to win three times in order to take the game. You do not need to win consecutively to win the game. There are about a handful of characters to choose from at the moment. Some characters are available to unlock while others are DLC's. All character designs are quite unique and all move differently from one another. I haven't noticed any significant diversity in speed between the characters. More or less, all characters seem to jump just as high as one another and move as fast as one another. Is this a good thing? Depends. It offers a level playing field for everyone but mixing up the game is never a bad idea. One person may prefer speed while another may prefer brawn. The only issue I have so far is that players are not able to melee or hit one another without a power up. Sure, this may be good as people aren't whacking one another always but some players I have played with mentioned that a melee addition would make it more engaging. Nonetheless, the game is still enjoyable and power ups provide a great addition to the game. Some of the power ups included are a grappling hook to grab the nearest opponent that pulls them back and you forward, boxes that opponents can run into, a force ball that completely slows and pushes opponents and a homing rocket missile (just to name a few). Levels themselves are quite challenging and take a bit of time to get used to and really good at. It is a bit overwhelming at first playing online and getting completely smoked by veteran players. If one's really persistent on getting good, it does take a little grinding to familiarize yourself with the level design. Visuals are quite simple and suit the games needs. It's not over the edge 3D but the graphics do fit the atmosphere. I wouldn't mind seeing a little more done in regards to animations or things happening in the background. Heck, why not have players influence some of the backgrounds/graphics. Why not even have them alter the stage? This is possible to a certain extent as levers are present throughout levels. These levers open and close paths and definitely add some more interest to the game. Sounds are pretty decent at this point and aren't extremely varied character to character. Dialogue is slightly different but wouldn't hurt to add a few more sounds to the voices. Overall, not a bad game in it's current form. There is a lot of opportunity here to take the game beyond being a simple linear running game. Although be it so, there's some serious fun to have online or between your buddies. I'm really, really, really hoping they add some mini-games or some more diversity into the game. They got a nice engine, let's do more with it!Indie Rating : 7.6/10EARLY ACCESS RATING : 6.95/10Gameplay C+ Story / Campaign N/A Visuals / User Interface B- Sounds / Music C+ Replay-ability B- Overall  C+PS - Why can't you take in-game screenshots with F12?

content:
Posted: October 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is a fast-paced, competitive and enjoyable experience especially if you're playing with friends or with other individuals around the world. What makes this game so thrilling, is that you're trying to become the best runner within the match while facing some frustrating obstacles and hazards, but the real dangers are the players within the game what makes this game so exciting and worth playing. However, if you do want to play online and go up against people with bad WI-FI signals, then that takes the fun out of the game, but I'd recommend you playing with individuals you know, but if you don't have friends pray if you find people who have good WI-FI connection while playing ranked or quick match. In the end, that's what the game is all about fast, fun and a crazy experience and I truly recommend it if you want something simple, but competitive.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Speedrunners is easily one of my favorite multiplayer games. Think 'Mario Kart if it was a platformer' or 'Smash Bros if it was a racing game'. The gameplay is super addictive once you get a handle on the controls (supposedly it's easier with a gamepad/controller, but I like the keyboard controls fine), and the community is pretty nice for the most part. My advice for new players would be to try out the origins mode in addition to the tutorial: it allows for instruction/practice on individual game mechanics as well giving some backstory on the game (even if it's pretty basic).The workshop is super cool too. It's really interesting getting to see the creative and challenging level designs made by other players.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												Played this game back in the early access/Beta, well damn its just as fun as it was back then, even more fun now-a-days, its a pretty good challenge.Basically, you and up to 3 other people race around a map, wall jumping, grappling onto ceilings and launching yourselves for more speed and mess with others with items like rockets and crates.The Maps are pretty well designed, some have a "Theme" to them such as nightclub having LOTS of Grappling hook-able ceilings, King of the swingers style map.The goal? Knock everyone else off the screen, once one person goes off screen (if its not just 2 players), Red border appears, as the remaining runners keep going, that border gets smaller and smaller, meaning the players are gonna have to get tighter together and pull some fancy stuff to out-speed the others.The music? i havn't really played much since they added the new music, but from what i've heard so far, its really nice, fitting, up-beat and active, tempo and feel gets a bit more "Chaotic" when the red border comes into play, Gives you the feeling of "Don't slip up now!".Game worth it? Totally, it was worth it back in the early access beta, and its worth it now, The game's basically more polished since then, and more characters, hell, even a story by the looks of it.

content:

Early Access Review
								While this game is a TON of fun, sometimes I think the developers care more about content than fixing bugs.  Often times there are MAJOR mechanics issues, but the next update is just more maps and more characters and more gimmicks.  This game could be one of the best games out there if the devs focused more on some of the clipping/mechanical flaws of this game.  All that being said, I really think this is a great game with quite a good competitive aspect to it.  This game isn't known by many right now, but I could see it going viral when all the little quirks get figured out!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is a competitive racing game that is undeniably fun to play! The game is in beta at the time of this review, so I will note that there are bugs that exist in the game; these bugs are not game-breaking but you may find yourself a bit confused at times as to what's happening. The game has a very straightforward control system that can easily be learned. The learning curve to the game is relatively low, just about anyone can play it and have fun. One thing I was really impressed with, were the animations for the characters in SpeedRunners. There was a lot of detail put into every frame for the actors in the game. The stage design may be my only gripe with the game. I think all of the stages are fantastic, but there are some awkward placements of traps in the game that will make you question the purpose of its location. SpeedRunners doesnt have much of a story mode, its multiplayer aspect is where the game shines. So if you're looking for a game to play with a group of friends for some friendly trash-talking fun, I'd suggest buying SpeedRunners!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game plays awesome. Simple, yet spot on !It has a fairly steep learning curve, even after 50 hours of gameplay I can still find a faster route, or even a way to get from point A to B.It is your typical 2D chasing game with fun elements up to 4 players. Rules are simple. If you fall behind the edge of the field-of-view, you are out. There are multiple routes you can choose from,  boosts, items to pick up and use against the opposing players, and you can trip them as well. There are a handful of fixed maps to play (they just don't get boring for some reason), and also every week there are new featured workshop maps.I play it with 5 of my friends, so I would say the game has it's replayability in playing co-op with your friends, tho ranked matches provide enough fun fof quite a few hours.May the fastest win !

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								For those of you who are wondering, SpeedRunners is basically Mario Kart meets Smash Bros. The goal? Race ahead of other players using items, speedboosts, and grappling hooks until one by one your opponents fall behind, touch the edge of the screen, and die.This game is a blast both local and online, and run pretty smoothly for the most part. I do occasionally run into weird bugs where the game will randomly kill everyone, refuse to kill someone, or follow someone other than the leader, but it's never much of a problem.The single player time-trial-like mode isn't that great, but you'll probably have too much fun in the multiplayer to notice. There aren't as many items as a Mario Kart game, but most of them are pretty cool: a hook to latch on to a player in front, a bomb that can be remotely detonated, a homing missile, a drill to speed you up and make you invincible, and crates to block incoming missiles and hooks or to trip up opponents. The stages are also great, featuring hard to reach shortcuts and alternate paths that can be closed off. Also, I have to say, once you master the grappling hook, getting around the stages feels so good.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pros: Very addicting          Almost always new things to learn         Many cool maps being made by other people         Once you get good at it, it's really fun to playCons: Glitches on certain workshop maps and even on official maps sometimes           No ranked yet so matchmaking isnt really fair yet as you can get matched with people who are better than you           Not many people playing right now so when its out of beta and you get ranked very high i imagine it will be hard to find a match, even now it takes a while to find a match depending on what time it isOverall its a good, intense, and addicting game. Once it's out of beta i would expect that most of the glitches have been fixed and ranked is up so that matchmaking can be better. Would definitely recommend this for people who enjoy fast paced and quick decision making like games. Sorry for being so lengthy.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Speedrunners is easily one of my favorite multiplayer games. Think 'Mario Kart if it was a platformer' or 'Smash Bros if it was a racing game'. The gameplay is super addictive once you get a handle on the controls (supposedly it's easier with a gamepad/controller, but I like the keyboard controls fine), and the community is pretty nice for the most part. My advice for new players would be to try out the origins mode in addition to the tutorial: it allows for instruction/practice on individual game mechanics as well giving some backstory on the game (even if it's pretty basic).The workshop is super cool too. It's really interesting getting to see the creative and challenging level designs made by other players.

content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								im not gunna lie, im a bit addicted to this game xDI recommend this to anyone and everyone, it's really fun to play with you friends and people online.I really enjoy the rankings, gives people something to aim for (instead of just aimlessly playing over the same maps over and over, however i'd be fine with that ;3 ) It's great how you give players the opportunity to create levels and have the chance to be featured for others to play.I would suggest maaaayybeee creating a couple more official maps? Just because during the ranked matches, i prefer to stick to the maps i know well (the official ones), and replaying them can get a little bit boring. not complaining though, just a thought :)the only two things i think need fixing are the few bugs in the game. sometimes the camera is set completely away from all players- this can go on till the game ends, or just for one or two rounds. Rarely happens, but can get quite annoying when playing in ranked matches. Also, happening once or twice, my player randomly flew off the screen, causing me to die.The other thing, which is a lot less of a problem, is upon opening the game, the window is opened half on-half off my screen. Not sure if i'm the only one, but it's happened on both of my computers. overall great game, you should deffinitely have a play of this when you can!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												Speedrunners is a game where you race in a map until one person achieves 3 wins at which point the lobby chooses another map. It is played with 2-4 players and has a variety of uses. At first when I played speedrunners I got it for a fun party game as well as online play with my friends. It would be a lot of fun running, jumping, and grappling around the map as we laughed. I didn't play it much like that when I started playing Online Matchmaking. People started crushing me in speed and that's where the game took more of a competetive feel. It wasn't until I felt like I was good enough to go on Ranked, where the real fun begins. I would've never expected such a simple game to have so much depth to it. The great thing about this game is that it has a variety of aspects that all do well. It is a party game for if friends come over, it is a fun online chill-out game to have a laugh as well. Then it is more about winning in online. After online and into ranked you start in entry league and it is pretty basic. It is around when I am now expert league and I am facing bronze league's where the game really starts to show what it has to offer. Serious competition, but still about laughing and having a good time with random people you are facing. This game is for almost anyone except people who rage easily for no reason. Please don't get the game if you are that person. Nobody wants to play with that person. Actually nevermind, just don't get any game that I play. I never want to play with that person.tl;dr  The more you play, the more you discover about the game, the more you have fun. If you don't want to pay full price that is ok because if you want to support the devs more you can buy trails for .99 cents each. It's an in-game store I actually enjoy having for many reasons. Whenever you are playing, always remember that there is room to get better so don't worry!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is just a 2D Mario Cart. Fantasticly frustrating, but is so fun that you never become overly frustrated with it or other players.It is extremely fast paced so when you first start you will lose immediatly guaranteed but the game is so simple and straight forward that in half and hour you will be right on the tale of the people that we leaving you for dead just a shot time before.This is still the beta so the solo missions are a little bare. But its the multiplayer that you want, it is smooth, connects quicly and so far I have not had a single flame or troll. When we die we are laughing with each other, even when its your own character that has just completely messed up. The game has the game play and skill level that it could be extremely competive if thats the sort of game you want. However as I said before it is fun and cute enough for those that simply want to have fun  can enjoy it as well. And you will have fun.  As its the Beta their is only one weapon to be collected in the multiplayer at the moment, a freeze ray that turns anyone it hits into a block of ice, but soon there will be more weapons added such a missles that seek the nearest opponent. (Red shells anyone ;) )At only £1.74 around $3 as its on sale at 75% off I would advise you to snap it up as its a really simple idea, but has been carried out extremely well by the creators. They have obviously put both love and time into this game which comes across in its easy going humour, In doing so they have created a wonderfully addictive, social and fun game. If they continue at this rate when it comes to the final and full version it will be chasing Mario Cart for the most fun racing game around and its freeze ray is more powerful than a blue shell.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game plays awesome. Simple, yet spot on !It has a fairly steep learning curve, even after 50 hours of gameplay I can still find a faster route, or even a way to get from point A to B.It is your typical 2D chasing game with fun elements up to 4 players. Rules are simple. If you fall behind the edge of the field-of-view, you are out. There are multiple routes you can choose from,  boosts, items to pick up and use against the opposing players, and you can trip them as well. There are a handful of fixed maps to play (they just don't get boring for some reason), and also every week there are new featured workshop maps.I play it with 5 of my friends, so I would say the game has it's replayability in playing co-op with your friends, tho ranked matches provide enough fun fof quite a few hours.May the fastest win !

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
Early Access Review
								Really fun + awesome game! :) If your into fast-paced platfomers with action then this is the game for you! :) SpeedRunners (the name kinda gives it away) you have gotta go fast (sonic reference intended) but really, you do. If you fall behind (go off the screen as it is constantly scrolling as you run) then you will be elminated (first to win 3 games). Think its that easy to keep ahead of the pack? not necessiarly as the items may change who wins, you have items that can give you a boost (Blue rocket) and items you can throw at your opponents to get them to the back of the pack (golden hook is known for doing this and rockets can help too) there are many items in the game and they are all are great in their own way :). Many maps to choose from both Dev created and community created and many characters to choose from also (if you put /gangbeast in superchat you get to play as him in game in any colour) you can do this with the payday 2 chraracters too just by putting /Payday2  character so you can play as one of them e.g. /cloaker /wolf. The game is still in beta/early access so you can expect updates to this game (one was character commands and this new XP system) which is cool :). You may encounter some glitches but beta + very rare that i find them to be honest. The game has online and local play so this game is great for couch play too and online play :) the community is a mix really as you can get poor losers XD and players who are lke "fair play gg" but again, rare you'll see poor losers so don't let that put you off + bots are in this game too along with a single player origins story mode. With many modes to choose from (like ranked where you progress leagues) and custom match where you choose the rules (one being this wheel that decides your fate) you will be coming back to this game quite a lot as it is a lot of fun :) if you see it in sale or at full price (£7) its defo worth it as it also supports the devs! :) (check out the demo if your un-sure about it though :))

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Speedrunners is easily one of my favorite multiplayer games. Think 'Mario Kart if it was a platformer' or 'Smash Bros if it was a racing game'. The gameplay is super addictive once you get a handle on the controls (supposedly it's easier with a gamepad/controller, but I like the keyboard controls fine), and the community is pretty nice for the most part. My advice for new players would be to try out the origins mode in addition to the tutorial: it allows for instruction/practice on individual game mechanics as well giving some backstory on the game (even if it's pretty basic).The workshop is super cool too. It's really interesting getting to see the creative and challenging level designs made by other players.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
Early Access Review
								I really enjoy the game, yet I think the presentation and overall DESIGN (not the gameplay) is somewhat unpolished. The music is excellent and uplifting, yet I'd prefer at least 10 more tracks to the overall package.Right now, the design, personally, it feels more of a potpourri of singular good choices, that however don't really want to fit together as a whole:-> The stage design is very "clean" and sterile of some sort, yet the characters and overall design is aimed to be quirky?-> The music ranges from upbeat funk to Ska (please add more ;D!) and fits the quirky design, yet clashes with the sterile stage design, and even with some meaner looking characters-> the red "borders" when one player died are just ugly to look at - how about some fire animation of some sort, to actually "see" the danger?-> character design is highly (!) uneven in quality and "charme"-> German translation is amateurish. It seems like somebody posted the stuff on google translate. And I'm not even kidding. English wordplay and puns are translated 1:1 and is REALLY wonky in german.-> I'd like to see instant emoticons or "taunts" in gameplay. Just add another button ingame for "well done" "haha" or "lucker!" :D Chatting while playing is nearly impossible - so why not allow ingame-taunting and ingame-feedback :)The gameplay however is very much fun, and I recommend you playing it! :o)Right now, in Beta R44 : 8/10 (With high potential up!)

content:
Posted: July 8, 2015
Early Access Review
Really fun couch multiplayer game - I cannot stress this enough. We have played alot of this, and certainly will play alot more. It plays waaay more fun than it looks, trust me on this.Pros:+Plenty of little control details that rewards knowledge of the play system (i.e. sliding will dodge the golden hook - there are lots of little details like this)+Lots of levels, plus Steam Workshop+Awesome ranking system for online playCons:-Music is meh-Graphical/art style is meh IMO-DLC is not worth it - although I bought it to support the devsThe Pros far outweigh the Cons. Pick this up for some local fun and you will not be dissapointed.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2016
												I'm going to preface this by saying that I've only played through the story mode, but I feel like that actually captures the essene of what the game is, if not the entire spirit of it.I first purchased SpeedRunners as a sort of replacement for Runbow.  I didn't want to have to plug my Wii in all the time to just play one game.  Why not just buy a new running game, and let my litle black box gather more dust and grow more and more redundant in peace?The game is hectic.  Chaotic.  Deliightfully retro.  There were many times I was mere milliseconds away from an untimely elimination, only to boost and swing just right and propel myself to a dashing finish.  Oher times I was not so lucky, and was left groaning in annoyance and even frustration.  I can only imagine how that would look with three other people playing on the couch, too.  Probably a party.Long story short: buy it.  It's a good time, even on your own.  It only gets better from there.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												It's literally just a game about going ♥♥♥♥ing fast. Also has items to screw over your opponents. Has workshop support, mostly for maps. It also has plenty of maps to choose from in the vanilla game. The only negative about this game is that it puts the 1st place runner on a disadvantage, because of the way the camera works. So basically, The first place runner will have a smaller field of view than all the other runners.Edit: also, you get lots of skins throughout the game as you level up. They're really cool. I think they're 70% of the things that make me keep playing the game, to be honest.

								This is a extremely entertaining game. But there is always another opportunity.One suggestion I would make (even when it doesn't apply to me) is that I believe that High Ranking matches should have no powerups/items. I believe that in higher levels these spoil the game a little.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												Played this game back in the early access/Beta, well damn its just as fun as it was back then, even more fun now-a-days, its a pretty good challenge.Basically, you and up to 3 other people race around a map, wall jumping, grappling onto ceilings and launching yourselves for more speed and mess with others with items like rockets and crates.The Maps are pretty well designed, some have a "Theme" to them such as nightclub having LOTS of Grappling hook-able ceilings, King of the swingers style map.The goal? Knock everyone else off the screen, once one person goes off screen (if its not just 2 players), Red border appears, as the remaining runners keep going, that border gets smaller and smaller, meaning the players are gonna have to get tighter together and pull some fancy stuff to out-speed the others.The music? i havn't really played much since they added the new music, but from what i've heard so far, its really nice, fitting, up-beat and active, tempo and feel gets a bit more "Chaotic" when the red border comes into play, Gives you the feeling of "Don't slip up now!".Game worth it? Totally, it was worth it back in the early access beta, and its worth it now, The game's basically more polished since then, and more characters, hell, even a story by the looks of it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								this game is really fun multiplayer wise. best way I can describe it is like a 2D platforming race smash brothers. It's not very accurate I know, but it's basically like if you touch the edge of the screen in last place you die and if you touch the edge of the screen in first (while running the right way) you'll win the match. There's also items you pick up, kind of like mario kart I suppose, but actually dodgeable (for the most part)There is a single player mode, but its really really meh and I don't think the game is meant for single player at all anyway so don't buy it unless you have friends to play with or don't mind randoms online. Even for early access I think the game is certainly worth it and really fun. There's lost of custom levels to mess with too and at least a good handful of them are decent and fun enough. It's a pretty cool game and I haven't seen a concept like it before so I found it really interesting. Should try it out when you can. ignore the crappy youtube dlc btw, it adds nothing but youtube "celebrities" characters that don't do anything. I don't know why you would want to play as some lame nerd over a communist super hero

Early Access Review
								A great multi/single player game, Friendly devs, great updates.I'm serious, speedrunners kind of took over my life. After the first round I played against way to hard online opponents I knew this was a game where skills, routes and the use of pickups are extremely valuable. Multiplayer:  The multiplayer is extremely intens and fun. Grappling your friends across the screen dodging grappling hooks, planting   bombs, spawning inside blocks, it all is enjoyable.Singleplayer:  Speedrunners (In terms of being as fast as possible) and people with not that great internet will like this. Find the shortest ways in the levels and get above your friends' scores.Conclusion:  Speedrunners is a game suitable for most of the steam users. (Try it while being drunk)To those who are creative: Since r22 (I think) speedrunners has  the ability to create levels and upload them to the workshop.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you're a fan of competetive racing, parkour, costumed superheroes (chicken suits), and Mario Kart, then you'll love and/or hate this game. Kinda depends on your skill, and how much of a♥♥♥♥♥♥you are willing to be. Not for those that can't handle losing well. That aside, you can always learn from other players the best methods to apply to guarantee a win.Always a good equalizer, in case your group gets too good at this game, toss in a workshop map. Some are buggy enough, or well-designed enough, or brand new enough, that the utter lack of familiarity will re-balance the odds between skilled and unskilled (One of the best has to be Zero Skill, for it's simplicity, and utter insanity; especially with lethal spikes in play). Personally, I prefer to not see skill levels (SEE: Ranked Matches and their ranking system), and just take it up to chance, potential luck, and my adaptive abilities overall. It makes winning less of a bother, especially if I fall into a losing streak; plus, even the mighty have their times of bad luck, and relatively new players can profit off that and catch up.But to be honest, this game reminds me of the classic days of gaming on the consoles with my siblings with games like Super Bomberman and such. Overall, it's probably a good thing we're separated by a distance only the internet can keep us playing against each other with. I would be hit a ton of times for the many cheap shots I've used.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								SpeedRunners is an interesting hybrid between Sonic the Hedgehog, Ninja Gaiden, the Batman: Arkham games, and Mario Kart... which is to say it's a hectic mess of crazy fun.Oftentimes, the game becomes so insanely fast that you can't tell what's going on, but it never becomes frustrating or annoying.After one opponent is left in the dust (off screen), it sets off an explosion that begins to shrink the field of view, which makes long matches intense.As you try to outwit, outrun, and outluck your opponents, you can gain weapons with various effects (a homing missile that chases down nearby foes, a claw that yanks your opponent out of place and flings you ahead, a freeze ray, etc.). These can all be used brilliantly to mess up your opponents (or occasionally yourself if you're unfortunate).There's also your typical boosts, and the excellent grappling hook to help even the odds when you're falling behind, which adds even more to the fun.The graphics are simplistic but fitting. It's well animated, and has a very clean look. The downside is, when someone is far behind, the screen zooms out and makes it somewhat hard to see, or when the match has lasted for a great amount of time, it can be a bit difficult to see what's ahead as the screen closes in. However, this isn't a huge detriment.The audio sounds good and fitting, except the music is very repetitious. There's only one song while racing, and while it's catchy, it does grow old after a while.The vanilla stages are well designed, and have well placed shortcuts and traps, and have a very well placed risk-versus-reward-style layout for each one. The Workshop also provides random stages, which have varying levels of quality (naturally).Simply put, this game has a few flaws, but it's a blast, especially with a group of friends. It's a perfect example of a party game.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2014
Early Access Review
								this game is really fun multiplayer wise. best way I can describe it is like a 2D platforming race smash brothers. It's not very accurate I know, but it's basically like if you touch the edge of the screen in last place you die and if you touch the edge of the screen in first (while running the right way) you'll win the match. There's also items you pick up, kind of like mario kart I suppose, but actually dodgeable (for the most part)There is a single player mode, but its really really meh and I don't think the game is meant for single player at all anyway so don't buy it unless you have friends to play with or don't mind randoms online. Even for early access I think the game is certainly worth it and really fun. There's lost of custom levels to mess with too and at least a good handful of them are decent and fun enough. It's a pretty cool game and I haven't seen a concept like it before so I found it really interesting. Should try it out when you can. ignore the crappy youtube dlc btw, it adds nothing but youtube "celebrities" characters that don't do anything. I don't know why you would want to play as some lame nerd over a communist super hero

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												So i'm only silver league but i've been playing this game for nearly 2 years and heres my honest opinion:I have always loved this game and it was such an exiting, enjoyable and competative experience. But since its released most of the few good Australian players stopped playing, or at least arent as active as they used to. This makes at least in my case very difficult to find a game at all. Let alone being evenly matched.Gameplay whise this game opens up so much room for skill developement and the constant strive to be the best. With the limited singleplayer replay value this pushes most players to the online area of Speedrunners. Online can be very pleasant and fun to play whether it be playing with some old mates or making new ones by yourself everyone on there seems to be mature and friendly.As the online connection is P2P (No servers), one person with faulty internet can pretty much ruin the experience of everyone else as it breaks the game most the time and you end up frozen in a game.Recently with the games release they have introduced trails for people to buy with microtransactions, this really felt out of place with the whole arcade style of the game and I have rarely seen people using them.Alltogether this is quite an amazing fun to play game, I reccomend buying a 4 pack and gifting it around as it is best played with friends!

content:
Posted: August 22, 2016
												This is a fast paced insanely fun game with a great art style (reminiscent of the movie Incredibles) and a fun soundtrack. The beginning of SpeedRunners is a bit problematic for example it took me a while to figure out how to change the controls. And the story is only useful because of the new characters you can get, but the dialogue is painfully cliche. It's obvious that this is truly a great game but I would only recommend getting it if you have someone else to play with. PDHD gives this game a 7/10. Fun.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5
												Fantastic, competitive, fast paced fun. Easily the best use of money I've made. Swing, jump, slide, and, yes, run through a variety of original and user made levels. Use items to make your friends (or enemies) fumble, stop, and get knocked out so you may burst through the pack. In that sense it is similar to such masterpieces as Dokapon Kingdom and Mario Kart and Party, it is a fun "friend destroyer", Level up to get new items, maps, characters, and skins. The only problems are that it's best with friends, so you'll have to convince friends to purchase the game, or you'll have to buy the 4-pack, the story lacks, though that isn't the main focus, and that, without expansion packs, there are few characters (but the workshop makes up for that). I give it a 9/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2016
												This is that kind of game that you buy not to write a review or to get achievements, but to have fun. If you bought this game to write a review, you probably already forgot it and have a few hundred hours now. It's absolutely an immersive experience - it is simple, fast(depending on your skill... or luck), fun and interesting. I don't know any similar games to this and it is indeed how they describe it themselves. It is really interesting to play with better players and get knowledge from them, while also it's really cool to teach some. And apart those two things, then there's insane fun when lots of unintended things happen, where you could accidentally win by insane luck against a pro.I have it since the early stages of the game, been watching it even since it was r2x or so. The gameplay is absolutely amazing, at the start it might be confusing, but with time it gets only better. It is fast, and you get a hook. And items. I think that is fun enough to do insane s*** haha.GraphicsWell, its obviously not a realistic 3d real life game. Personally I love the art style and the design. It's a really nice style, an open style I would say. The animations are really nice, plus the taunts. Wonderful. The animations at times is like a type of communication between players, and it is interesting for how many expressions a single taunt can be used.Fancy styleGood animationsGreat tauntsStoryWell, it just got there not a long time ago. But it is not what you're buying this game for haha. It is what will probably introduce you to the game as a new player, and for a new player the unfair difficulty can be really unfair.Short storyRather newbie-friendly, but good introduction to the game mechanics as a storyVery easy for early access players.Sound(track)The sounds in the game are really well done, the soundtrack is amazeballs. it's really fun to play listening to it and it gives you lots of fun. Great sounds(grapple, swing, items)Fancy and fun soundtrackA little con might be:Characters do not talk or suchOverall, yes, this game is worth every cent it is sold for. It gives you all the features you need to have a great time and to get hooked to spend a million hours of playing. If you see it on a discount, grab it immediately.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												So i'm only silver league but i've been playing this game for nearly 2 years and heres my honest opinion:I have always loved this game and it was such an exiting, enjoyable and competative experience. But since its released most of the few good Australian players stopped playing, or at least arent as active as they used to. This makes at least in my case very difficult to find a game at all. Let alone being evenly matched.Gameplay whise this game opens up so much room for skill developement and the constant strive to be the best. With the limited singleplayer replay value this pushes most players to the online area of Speedrunners. Online can be very pleasant and fun to play whether it be playing with some old mates or making new ones by yourself everyone on there seems to be mature and friendly.As the online connection is P2P (No servers), one person with faulty internet can pretty much ruin the experience of everyone else as it breaks the game most the time and you end up frozen in a game.Recently with the games release they have introduced trails for people to buy with microtransactions, this really felt out of place with the whole arcade style of the game and I have rarely seen people using them.Alltogether this is quite an amazing fun to play game, I reccomend buying a 4 pack and gifting it around as it is best played with friends!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												SpeedRunners - My personal reviewI bought this game in the official steam shop after it was mentioned in one of PewDiePie´s slightly older videos. It has been reduced by 75% from the original price so I payed about 4 euros in total, at this point my expectations weren´t that high so I first thought that i´d spend about 20 hours in the game. After a few matches and when i started to figure out the special mechanics that the game has it really started getting interesting and fun to play. Now I spent 46 hours in the game and that after about 6 weeks of buying it and after all this time its stil enjoyable and on top of that it became one of my favourite games i´ve ever played.It is a jump n´run multiplayer game without any type of story you need to mention, so there is a tutorial but the game is just about the gameplay and not about the graphics or the campaign.You shouldn´t buy this game if you´re looking for a revolutionary game in every point but if you´re into games like this its definetly worth youre money although i have to say that you should wait until its getting reduced again.-----EDIT------After they ve added a new "ELO" system, ranked gamplay isnt fun any longer. It is super buggy (f.e. some players do get around 20+ points for a win while others including me only getting +2 for every match, nevermind if they beat high or low elo players). If youre looking for a ranked focused jumpNrunner game i would not recommend you this anymore!

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								*This review is written from the point of view of someone who has only played singleplay and local multiplayer*SpeedRunners is a great arcade style racing game (if you can call it that) which is fast paced and great to play with friends and family. It's similar to popular kart racing games except you run rather than drive a kart.+Really nice art style +Plenty of cool skins to choose from for your character+Works well for local multiplayer+Good BOTs+Well designed and fun to play maps+From what I can tell it has a good competitive multiplayer system though I haven't played it myself+Reasonable price and good value for money+The Devs release new skins every so often+Fun to play+Good replayability+/-Relatively short matches, great if you just want a quick game of something-Not very many maps though it does have workshop support-Some of the items can be pretty annoyingVerdict:7A really fun game which is perfect for playing with family and friends
